solution_line_template: Hayden gave {num_groups_rides} groups rides, so he is owed {num_groups_rides} * {wage_per_ride} = $<<{num_groups_rides}*{wage_per_ride}={owed_for_rides}>>{owed_for_rides}.
He drove for {hours_driven} hours, so he is owed {hourly_wage} * {hours_driven} = $<<{hourly_wage}*{hours_driven}={owed_for_hours}>>{owed_for_hours}.
He refilled the gas tank, so he is owed back {gallons_gas} * {cost_per_gallon} = $<<{gallons_gas}*{cost_per_gallon}={owed_for_gas}>>{owed_for_gas}.
He got {num_good_reviews} good reviews for a bonus of {num_good_reviews} * {bonus_per_review} = $<<{num_good_reviews}*{bonus_per_review}={owed_for_reviews}>>{owed_for_reviews}.

Hayden is owned {owed_for_rides} + {owed_for_hours} + {owed_for_gas} + {owed_for_reviews} = $<<{owed_for_rides}+{owed_for_hours}+{owed_for_gas}+{owed_for_reviews}={total_owed}>>{total_owed} for his work today.
